website_summaries.verdict: The simple analog face teaches time and comes in several designs for both boys and girls.
pros: Minute and hour hand are labeled to help kids learn to tell time
Fun colors and designs let kids show off their personalities
Easy to take on and off with Velcro on the wristband
cons: The buckle on the band can easily come loose resulting in a lost watch

customer_reviews.title: Purchased twice. Dead battery both times.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work. Could hear the watch ticking once or twice, but didn't work. Cute and had an adjustable strap that fit my 6yo (she preferred to wear pretty loose). I'm returning and ordering another because this is one of the few ones that are advertised as water resistant. ** update ** Purchased a 2nd time. Battery dead again. I went to watch store and got the battery replaced for $6 because I like that this one has different colors for the hour hand and the minute hand as my daughter is just learning how to tell time. Also, this watch is supposed to be water resistant. We haven't tested that yet. Fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Grace C

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: I got this to help her learn how to tell time on an analog clock. We had some watches that had a traditional band (like a belt) and those were hard to put on and take off. The stretch band on this one makes it much easier for her to take off and put back on. She has said that the ticking does keep her awake at night, but I expect that would be true on pretty much any watch. I've had several Timex watches over the years and they always seem to wear well. I am overall pretty happy with the watch and it has helped my daughter get better at telling time.
customer_reviews.author: scott696d

customer_reviews.title: The perfect kids’ watch
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect watch for your child! I gifted this to my children once they turned 7 and learned how to read time! My kids loved it as it also has the minutes by 5 and it helped them as they learned multiplication by 5! It is very lightweight and comfortable so your child will wear it daily! You don’t have to worry about it falling off since it’s an elastic band. It is also water resistant, making it the perfect kid watch! I wish they sold replacement bands because it will wear out after a year. My daughter’s watch face completely broke too! However, she wore it daily!
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: Timex Girls Time Machines Analog Elastic Fabric Strap Watch is a good watch for girls. It has clear numbers and lines. It is a good watch for a kid who is learning to tell time. They love the designs and colors. It's the perfect girly mix. They really like wearing this watch. It's comfortable to wear and doesn't scratch them or hurt them. No complaints about that. This watch is also pretty durable. The strap doesn't tear too easily. The face doesn't break. It's best to keep it out of water so it shouldn't get ruined or break. I recommend this watch.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this watch, after researching the best buy for a 2nd grader who is learning to tell time. This was recommended also because it is better made for children to set the watch without it breaking inside. It is a beautiful watch with a good band for a young lady to whom I plan to give as a birthday gift in two weeks. Her sister learned in the same watch and it is still running perfectly. I was happy to see that it arrived, in perfect shape, even though the package had been squashed in transport. The box the watch was in had been crushed. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: The bands are adjustable and comfortable. I highly recommend this watch
customer_reviews.text: This is the 8th Timex kids watch that I have purchased for my 8 kids. They hold up forever. I still have the one my oldest (now 22) used to wear. Each of the kids learned to tell time on these durable and affordable analog watches. The batteries are readily available at any jeweler or jewelry counter at most discount stores, although the batteries do seem to last for years. The bands are adjustable and comfortable. I highly recommend this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Silversp00ns

customer_reviews.title: Repair is more than new watch
customer_reviews.text: The strap loosens easily. The watch slows down one week after we got it. Wrote timex since there is warranty. But i have to send back and pay $8 for return shipping. That would be the price of a new watch.
customer_reviews.author: Wheatie

customer_reviews.title: Dead Batteries — Doesn’t Work
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for 7 year—old and expected good quality item as I believe Timex is a good brand. First one arrived and had dead battery. Ordered a replacement. 2nd one also didn’t work. Maybe they are shipping and old batch. In any event can’t recommend as this product doesn’t perform its intended function.
customer_reviews.author: Armi

customer_reviews.title: The watch from the pizza place was better quality...
customer_reviews.text: This is some cereal box type stuff. The strap is a joke and doesnt stay on (just make it a snap or a clip or something?!) the watch face lasted about 23 hours before it was scratched up. Doesnt matter because its never on my 4yr olds wrist... its just in 2 pieces somewhere around the house that i find with the vacuum cleaner. She has a free plastic watch that stays on and is easy to read and keep track of her schedule which was the whole point of having a watch.
customer_reviews.author: Dana H.

customer_reviews.title: I should have trusted the poor reviews. I find this to be more an ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not work when it arrived. I wish I had tested it first as it was a gift for my granddaughter's birthday. I should have trusted the poor reviews. I find this to be more an Amazon issue as this one looked like it may have been returned. The watch itself is adorable. I bought this same watch through Target and it works perfectly and is adorable.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Mort

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, durable, pretty watch for a little girl to learn to tell time
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my daughter LAST Christmas - and this Christmas it is still working. It has really been helpful in teaching her to tell time on an analog watch - and she loves using it & loves the look of it. Overall a great product & I highly recommend it! (it does occasionally "lose" a minute or two - I wouldn't use it for a precision time piece - but it is PERFECT for everyday use)
customer_reviews.author: Another Reader

customer_reviews.title: Pretty little watch for our 4 year old...
customer_reviews.text: Our little girl is loving her watch. She is four and fixing to be five. The adjustable band allows for a smaller wrist and definitely room for her to grow into. She has been wearing it ever since she got it. Even wearing it swimming and it does not have any problems resisting water. It is very comfortable for her, no complaints at all. Our favorite part is this watch is helping her to tell the time. The numbers around the dial are perfect for this purpose. She's already been doing really well with telling time, this just continues the growth.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Did NOT run, dead battery.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these, received it in a slightly damaged box and the watch was not running. I ordered another one (returned the first) and the second watch was not running either. So frustrating. Because I wanted to give this to my neighbor, who is home schooling her granddaughter during the pandemic, to help teach her how to tell time, I decided to get a new battery on my own. Bottom line, I paid another $12 dollars to have a battery put in. I feel completely ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: bellinghambargainhunter

customer_reviews.title: Arrived running.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these; one for a boy and one for a girl. They arrived and they are very cute but both were running. So I’m wondering how long the batteries will last. Watches usually have a little piece of plastic under the stem so the battery doesn’t wear down. These do not. A little disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: pv1940

customer_reviews.title: Great for teaching little ones to tell time
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and has a very legible face. My 5yo was telling time with it in under a week. I was so proud. Super cute, comfy and easy for her to slide on and off. Not backlit and seems to get juuuuust a tad slow but it’s a watch for a 5 year old, not an atomic clock. Taught her how to tell time by reading the hands, not sure what else you want for $15-20.
customer_reviews.author: NS

customer_reviews.title: Should not have to disappoint little child with TWO watches that were DOA...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two watches for two grandchildren. One arrived in working condition. The other does not work, probably a dead battery. Returned the noon-working watch and requested a replacement. Replacement arrived today. Does not work. Probably a dead battery. Called Timex and was given the battery type to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: draw123z4

customer_reviews.title: Its great!
customer_reviews.text: I was originally going to buy this at Walmart or target. But when I went to the store Target didn't have any girls watches (and very few boys watches), and Walmart had a small selection and they were mostly digital. We wanted an analog watch. So happy Amazon has just about everything. I loved that the watch is color coordinated, with a soft adjustable band. Great for kiddos learning to tell time. Fits my 7 yr old
customer_reviews.author: Stephstuff

customer_reviews.title: Colorful watch. Easy to read.
customer_reviews.text: Very cute watch. I like the soft, adjustable band. My daughter just turned five, and this will be very useful in teaching her to tell time. Unfortunately, the watch arrived without a working battery. I decided it’s easier to buy a new battery than to return it since I like all the other features of the watch, but it was a pretty big disappointment on Christmas morning.
customer_reviews.author: Stenogirl

customer_reviews.title: Great kids watch!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old really wanted a watch for her birthday, and we had such a difficult time finding something to fit her tiny wrists. This watch saved the day. The adjustable band works like a charm and stays put. It’s also great for learning to tell time because they also have smaller numbers incrementally next to the minute tick marks.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Landry

customer_reviews.title: Good first watch
customer_reviews.text: This watch is very soft and comfortable. Perfect for a first watch. We thought it may be hard to read because the colors are a bit muted. We were right (hence the 3 stars instead of 4), but it doesn't seem to bother my daughter. She love the look. It is so cute that it has motivated her to learn how to tell analog time instead of digital. She really wanted a digital watch, but as soon as she saw this one, she forgot about digital entirely. It is a little light weight, so we will have to see how it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: C. DANIEL

customer_reviews.title: Too bad the strap is chintzy
customer_reviews.text: I really like the great design of the clock part of this watch... perfect for learning how to tell time and also very cute. But the strap was very disappointing. It adjusts, but they left a rough unfinished edge on the stretchy nylon material. A child needs something more durable. I didn't want to ask my niece, but I bet it didn't stay on well and it would've gotten all frayed... a throw away.
customer_reviews.author: KMN

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality as full size Timex
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered several Timex Kids watches because I love the look and I expect them to last. But they never do. All have stopped working within a few months. I get the battery changed but the watches do not come back to life. I am a big Timex fan for full sized watches. So I am doubly disappointed by the failure of the Kids series.
customer_reviews.author: Ronbow

customer_reviews.title: Watch YES, Band NO
customer_reviews.text: It's OK. The watch itself is great! Easy to read, helpful for a child to learn how to tell time and the concept of 'how long is 10 minutes'. The colors are bright and my grand daughter loves to wear it. But....the band is worthless. No matter how tight you pull it or how carefully you weave it through the little cinch loops, it does not hold. 20 minutes tops before everyone has to get on their hands and knees and look for it. This is not rough play...this is a little 7 year old girl playing with her dolls inside the house. Look for one with a real band that will buckle and actually fasten.
customer_reviews.author: Williegg

customer_reviews.title: It's a Timex.
customer_reviews.text: I knew what I was buying for my granddaughter to learn to tell time on a real watch. I knew because I bought basically the same watch 20-30 years ago. I still have two of them and they still work fine. This one seems to be a little smaller, but otherwise the same. She'll be able to give it to one of her kids.
customer_reviews.author: pencilpusherTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: she loves it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my granddaughter for her 7th birthday. The band is comfortable and stretchy and adjusts to fit a small wrist. The dial makes it easy to read for a child learning to tell time. She always has the correct time now and doesn't have to ask "How much longer?". And it's really cute too.
customer_reviews.author: Chicgal

customer_reviews.title: Happy Mama
customer_reviews.text: Love the elastic band feature so my daughter can slip it on and off easily. This watch is a great learning watch, we wanted something with all the minute tick-marks and this watch was one of the few that had that feature at a good price and well-reviewed. Very pretty for an everyday kids watch and not so frilly that she's gonna hate it with the next passing fad.
customer_reviews.author: D. Christiansen

customer_reviews.title: Ticks loud, but is very durable and easy to read.
customer_reviews.text: Still wearing it! It's durable and the face barely has marks on it after constant use. The band is very easy to wash - simply thread the watch body off the band, wash the band in warm soap and water, then rethread when dry. Only complaint is that the ticking is VERY loud for such a small watch. Still, it works great for my tiny lady wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Alex R

customer_reviews.title: Better to get a watch with a larger dial and ...
customer_reviews.text: Only took one star off for lack of any backlight feature. Also the numbers are incredibly small, the outside minute markers are almost impossible to read. Better to get a watch with a larger dial and bigger hour markers. But my daughter likes it and it has lasted more than one dip in the pool so its good enough in my book
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Steinkamp

customer_reviews.title: I ordered thiswatch and the times hearts and butterflies and the my ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this watch and the times hearts and butterflies and the my first timex watches for my 2 granddaughters and one grandson. According to the descriptions all 3 watches were "indiglo" which was the reason for my order. They were intrigued with my own Timex indiglo watch. Well the other 2 were indiglo (you push a button and the background lights up - handy in the dark), but this one was not. I just returned it and found the same watch that is definitely indiglo at Walmart. Amazon is great about accepting items for return that are not as described.
customer_reviews.author: Ania

customer_reviews.title: Terrible strap, but nice little watch.
customer_reviews.text: Very cute and appropriately sized for young children. My daughters really love theirs, with one exception... The strap is terrible. It adjusts as small as you need it to be, but no matter what you do (short of stitching the loose end to the rest of the strap) it loosens as they play and the watch eventually falls off. Because of the garbage strap that will not work without modification, it gets 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tripton

customer_reviews.title: First Grader Stamp of Approval
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my first grader as a Christmas gift. She learned how to tell time on an analog watch in about 10 minutes. The band is flexible, comfortable and adjustable, as well as easy to read. The cards and mini clock are a nice addition to help kids practice in a larger format. I'll be looking for another one for my son soon!
customer_reviews.author: KFO

customer_reviews.title: Good...but a few things could be better...
customer_reviews.text: The labeling on the hands has helped our 7 yo but I wish the numbering did not count down from the half hour. Also, the "boy scout belt" clip on the band is not easy for her to use. But in general she likes it and it has given her a reason to spend more time trying to tell time by analog display, which is the most important thing.
customer_reviews.author: A. Winston

customer_reviews.title: Fits well
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a watch to wear while getting sweaty. Metal bands get blackish buildup, yuck! Leather bands have a flap that sticks out and catches on everything. This band doesn't stick out nor gets gross. I have a small wrist, so it's just right for me! It's also easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: cindylynnie

customer_reviews.title: Adorable, easy to read kids watch
customer_reviews.text: This is a great analog watch for kids. It's comfortable, looks really cute, and is easy to read. The butterfly second-hand is a cute touch, and makes it look even more fun. The hands are color coded to match the colors of the hour and minute numbers, making it perfect for kids learning to read an analog clock. It's nicely sized, too, and doesn't look huge or bulky on small wrists. Overall, it's a really fun, adorable watch that works well and is easy to read. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this. The watch is so cool with the starfish moving on the second hand, and the whole thing is the perfect size for a kid. Then there's the band. It's just right for kids! Adjustable, and elastic so it always fits and is super easy to put on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Lubbz

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute little watch. Seems to be well made. We’ve gotten off brand watches on Amazon that broke the first day. This one seems like it is going hold up. Excellent price, too. My daughter loves the butterfly second hand and the numbers that tell her the minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Nice for Kids
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is nice and perfect for Children. The watch is elastic Band which makes it nice too. Love it. Cant wait to put it under the Christmas tree for the Children, to tell them it was from Santa
customer_reviews.author: Bernie

customer_reviews.title: Cute watch to bad it doesn't work...
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get this watch for our granddaughter. It's her favorite colors and she would be able to put it on herself. She is just beginning to tell time. To bad the watch doesn't work!!! unfortunately I cannot provide anything positive about the watch since it was broken/not working when we recieved. I will be returning it anf looking for a different one for her.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend this product but love Timex!
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, poor watch size as a true teaching aid for recommended ages between pre-k/3 graders (watch face is too small for them to adequately read time). Would recommend Timex make the watch face bigger for little/young learners. My Daughter said she could not use it personally. Requesting return/refund.
customer_reviews.author: Snopkie

customer_reviews.title: Made a perfect gift.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 7 yo niece, whom I was meeting for the very first time. She loved it. She wore the watch on the first day of her school and was very proud to show it off to her friends! I am not yet sure about it's durability, functionality or usability for a 7 year old kid, hence not giving it a full 5 stars. I will update this review in a few weeks after I know more from my niece or her mom.
customer_reviews.author: PVP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids to learn to tell time and stylish, too!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old loves her new watch! So easy for her to learn to tell time! And it's comfortable for her to wear for extended periods. We haven't tested it in water yet. I love that it says minutes and hours right on the watch hands. Would buy again and probably will for friend's birthday gifts.
customer_reviews.author: G. G.

customer_reviews.title: All-Around Great Watch!
customer_reviews.text: Santa put this watch in my 3rd grader's stocking and she immediately figured out how to tell time using a second hand. She spent the whole day on Christmas telling us what time it was! Now she can look at other clocks and also tell time. This is a handy little watch! I am particularly a fan of the elastic wristband that is extremely comfortable for my daughter and also doesn't cause her to sweat like rubber or metal watch bands tend to do.
customer_reviews.author: Anna in PDX

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Well, we love the watch....BUT the battery did not even work... and there is no velcro for the strap.. I took it to a watch repair shop, and I had to get a 13 dollar brand new battery put in it, not to mention the cost of labor.... so basically I put 20 bucks into a 20 dollar watch...smh.
customer_reviews.author: hooked4life

customer_reviews.title: Cute. Fits my 4 year old.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is perfect for my 4 year old preschooler who is learning to tell time. I have had no problems adjusting the watch to her small wrist. There may have been some design changes since some of the earlier reviews. I can get it tight and it stays on. It's cute and the numbers on the face are easy enough to read.
customer_reviews.author: JoannaJ

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived looking like a returned product rather than a new product. Packaging not assembled correctly. Watch not displayed correctly in box. It was just tossed into the box and not on display stand. Unable to give as a gift in the condition it arrived in.
customer_reviews.author: A music & book Fan

customer_reviews.title: Very cute
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughter for Christmas so I can't comment yet on the longevity. I thought it would be a good starter watch for her to learn to tell time since the schools no longer teach it. Very cute. I'm sure she'll love it. I wish, however, that it had a normal watch band.
customer_reviews.author: Wifey

customer_reviews.title: Good overall, don't like second hand numbers
customer_reviews.text: The second numbers go up to 30 then back down on the other side to zero (15, 30, then back to 15 to zero) instead of going up to 60 (15, 30, 45). This made it confusing to my daughter who is learning how to tell time.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Falk

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I love timex watches with the elastic band. I work with my hands constantly and need a watch that can quickly be removed if it will be in the way. I give this watch 4 stars because there is no indiglo feature. I'm super bummed they stopped doing that.
customer_reviews.author: Katelynn M

customer_reviews.title: The minute numbers are weird.
customer_reviews.text: I dont like how the minutes on the left half are labeled with minutes until the next hour instead of just the minute. It was tricky explaining this to my daughter who is just learning how to tell what minute it is. Also, maybe I'm old, but it's almost too small to read.
customer_reviews.author: Ameech

customer_reviews.title: Very pretty for a little girl.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pretty watch for my little one, she can read a digital clock. I am trying to teach her analog. She knows her hours, but she cheats and checks the digital and then looks at her watch to tell me the time. She will learn. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Diane Verenbec

customer_reviews.title: It works and is pretty!
customer_reviews.text: It's working, is the best thing I could say about this Timex watch, as a training tool, it's the best approach we could have taken. The Color arrangement is perfect for my daughter, she loves the looks and feel of the watch. The strait forward labeling on the arms is, readable and functional. My first watch was a Timex, so I was proud to give her this one.
customer_reviews.author: B.C. O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: The watch wasn't working upon arrival and no manual provided
customer_reviews.text: The watch wasn't working when it arrived from Amazon. No instructions included. I looked online for a manual or trouble-shooting guide and could not find any help. Assume that the battery was dead but the only instruction regarding the battery was to take it to a watch repairer or jeweler for replacement. This would incur more cost than the watch is worth, and may not even fix the problem. I am returning the watch and plan to purchase a watch for my granddaughter in a brick and mortar store, in order to have a working product.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Zalom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first watch for kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought each of my kids one of these watches for Christmas. The strap is easy to adjust, and the watch face is easy to read. I took off a star because both watches arrived with dead batteries.
customer_reviews.author: naturalmamaTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for toddler
customer_reviews.text: Fits petite 3 year old. Looks exactly like the picture. My daughter has 3 of these watches. She loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Sandie Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great child’s watch!
customer_reviews.text: So happy to find a cute analog watch. Has held up wonderfully to 4 months of wear and tear. And my child can put it on and remove it herself. Pink and green colors are adorable!!!
customer_reviews.author: L.A.B.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Sweet watch , perfect for my 6 yr old to work on telling time. It stopped working after 8 weeks. Timex will replace it, as long as I send along $10 for shipping. I guess i expected a better product, and a better " no hassle guarantee" from TIMEX. Pretty sure i wouldn't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: MontAnna

customer_reviews.title: Dead watch
customer_reviews.text: Received this with an empty battery. Disappointing having to go through the return process. Likely this watch will go straight back into inventory and sold to the next customer.
customer_reviews.author: D. Golden

customer_reviews.title: Face scratches easily
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my six-year-old daughter for Christmas. Within 24 hours, the face was scratched so bad the bottom half was unreadable. And it's not like she was rubbing her wrists on concrete or anything - she was just being a kid, doing her usual kid stuff. The face really needs a raised edge around it to protect the plastic. Other than that, this is a great watch. She had no problem reading the small numbers around the edge, but she was very upset that the watch was ruined so quickly. I'm going to look for a different watch that can handle typical kids "rough and tumbleness" for her.
customer_reviews.author: K. M. Warr

customer_reviews.title: Great for elderly wrists!
customer_reviews.text: This watch was perfect for my elderly mother. Her skin is thin and fragile and the soft elastic band does not pinch like a linked band does. She can easily slide the watch on and off and no longer needs assistance to put her watch on each day. Perfect size for a small wrist, easy to read large face, and contemporary for a pop of color. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: absolute junk
customer_reviews.text: the cheap band wont even stay in it's adjustable latch. It's almost as if it was designed to be lost ( and then replaced). The numbers are too small to tell time without having to really examine the watch. I wouldn't recommend this watch to anyone. I bought this watch based on some good ratings. I wonder now if these people actually looked past the cute design to its functionality. I will be buying my girl a different watch but not from this retailer. I am getting increasingly annoyed at the junk that is sold here on amazon. It used to be a place to buy a quality product .....Not anymore
customer_reviews.author: telling the truth

customer_reviews.title: Great starter watch
customer_reviews.text: Great first watch for an 8 year old. The face of the watch is easy to read. The arms on the face of the clock have the words "hours "and "minutes" written on each arm so it is easy for beginners to tell time. It also has an arm that shows the seconds. On the outer rim of the face of the purple watch, is a pink edge, one darker pink ( to show the first 30 minutes after the hour) and then a lighter pink,to show the 30 minutes preceding the hour. The wrist band is flexible with enough stretch for easy off and on and has plenty of extra band material to expand as she grows.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy81

customer_reviews.title: I purchased thiswatch for my daughter to help her learn to tell ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this watch for my daughter to help her learn to tell time and while I like that each thirty minute increment is divided into two different colors, she finds it very confusing that it goes from 30 minutes to 25. Not sure what the thought process was here but had I paid closer attention I would not have purchased it. Also, it is VERY small and the numbers are TINY.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany S

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift - purple- lavender was the favorite color of child - appears to be well made band & she liked the design
customer_reviews.author: John Baylor

customer_reviews.title: Works great and holds up well
customer_reviews.text: Works great and holds up well! Been kicked around, buried in toy boxes, etc more than it's been on the wrist, but it still looks new and works perfect! The elastic band loosens up on it's own it seems like, but it is going on a tiny wrist and it doesn't loosen enough to fall off...just enough to be annoying for a 4 year old. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: amyjoy85

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed when I received this watch. My previous watch in this style and design (five years ago?) came with the "glow" feature, and the colors were more muted and more appropriate, I thought, for adults. Hopefully this will keep time as precisely as its predecessor.
customer_reviews.author: Angelwings

customer_reviews.title: Ok watch, band doesn't stay tight
customer_reviews.text: The watch is ok, but not what I'd hoped for. I wanted a fabric band. This band is soft, but doesn't stay once you adjust it. It continues to get looser. Also the hands are so small the words are hard to see.
customer_reviews.author: Lovetoshop

customer_reviews.title: Clock is great quality, watch can be too small.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the clock that comes with this as it seems to be made really well but the watch that comes with the clock was too small for some kids to read and the velcro strap is too small/tight for wearing. Also, I wished it came with more cards for practice so I wouldn't have to spend extra time making more cards.
customer_reviews.author: Shopperatwork

customer_reviews.title: They can tell time!
customer_reviews.text: These were gifts for a 7 and 5 year old. After a very brief lesson on what everything meant on the clock face, they are now successfully telling the time. These watches simplified the process and my kids feel so grown up wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of two

customer_reviews.title: the fabric strap is quite comfortable, however
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves the watch; the fabric strap is quite comfortable, however, the buckle doesn't hold. It is continually loosening & falling off. Is there a catch that might be missing? I noticed that the teeth on the buckle are straight. I've had similar buckles which have bent teeth. That helps to keep the buckle in place. This may be a manufacture flaw, perhaps.
customer_reviews.author: arennie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 4.5 year old!
customer_reviews.text: All my 4.5 year old wanted from Santa was a purple watch. This fit the bill! The stretchy band makes it easy for her to get on and off independently. It also is easy to tighten it for her small wrist. Perfect! She can’t read it (yet), but she can’t set off alarms in the middle of the night, either.
customer_reviews.author: JMFournier

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORKING
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3, one for my daugher and two for my daughter’s friends for their birthdays. When it was my daugher’s turn to open hers, the watch didn’t work from day 1! What big disappointment! (& embarrasment as the broken watches were already given to her friends who politely didn’t say anything about them!!!) When I took it to a watch repairer they told me that the moisture seal was broken so moisture got in and it couldn’t be fixed! Yep! This is a story of a brand new watch that was kept in the original box and was kept was in a bookshelf. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Vyvian Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great design for a kid's watch
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best kid's watch we have. It only has one dial (with no alarm) so the kids aren't always changing the time or accidentally turning on an alarm. The watch band is stretchy and adjustable so the kids can put the watch on and take it off all by themselves. The hour hand and the minute hand are clearly marked so it's easier for kids to tell the time. I would have given this 5 stars if the battery hadn't died in less than one month. The watch warranty does not cover the battery, so you need to factor that in to the cost.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: cute but lags behind telling time
customer_reviews.text: Very cute girls watch, I like the butterfly detail on the seconds hand so the butterfly goes around the watch. I returned and reordered because it does not keep the time, it gets behind more than 5min every day. The watch came with the battery running, hopefully that was the problem.
customer_reviews.author: bbuser

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect to use to teach time, especial with the minute and hour hand a different color. The second hand is a butterfly that goes in a circle which lessens the confusion for the different hands when teaching time. The elastic band is comfortable and my daughter can wear it all day.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie

customer_reviews.title: No Time.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter's lost both their watches. The band is not good for small children. My dad found one of their watches in the yard after running around playing. Suggest a latch that's adjustable. Loss of time and money. Also for children that are learning to tell time, the flower is in the way. Not a clear view of the minute hand.
customer_reviews.author: TeeCee

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic watch for practicing to tell time!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent choice for a littke girl's watch. I wanted an analog watch that has minute marks on it as well and in addition the butterfly moves as it measures seconds. Makes this watch perfect for kearning to tell time! I like the band as well you can make it as tight as you need. My daughter has a very small wrist so there is extra material but it doesn't bother Her. The band can be washed which is always a plus.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaVM

customer_reviews.title: Worse purchased ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this!!!!!!!!! I bought it for my daughter!! It came on a box that is totally destroyed also the item it self has a billions of scratches on the watch itself you can see it on the photo I attached!! Very very disappointed! Such a waste of time and money!!
customer_reviews.author: caesar

customer_reviews.title: Good (but not perfect) for a four-year-old
customer_reviews.text: Our four-year-old likes to know what time it is and when things are going to happen, so we kept pointing out the hands on our kitchen clock, but she also wanted a reference when we were out of the house. So we got this. As a watch, it works quite well; she can read the numbers, and the butterfly going around (the second hand) is fun too. The strap is actually too long for small wrists; tightening it was easy, but there's so much extra that she sometimes gets a little frustrated with it. But I still think it was a better choice than any other kid's watch out there, and I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Salkind

customer_reviews.title: Good, but the face of the watch is rather small
customer_reviews.text: This is good first watch for my child,but the face is smaller than I expected. It looks small even on my five year old's wrist. As soon as she's comfortable telling time, I'll get her a different timex with a larger face.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Deceiving watch for a new learner.
customer_reviews.text: For a "beginner" watch for a child learning to tell time, this watch could confuse them. Instead of the minutes past 30 being marked as 35-40-45-50, etc. They begin to count down, so 25-20-15-10. etc. VERY confusing for a 7 year old. 3:40 was looking like 3:20 to her, thanks to the markings on the watch. It made me sad to see her so frustrated. I used it as a learning tool to teach "20 minutes till 4" but that was over her head as she is still trying to grasp counting minutes on the clock. I will be buying her a new watch that doesn't confuse her.
customer_reviews.author: rickardfam5

customer_reviews.title: Kids watch
customer_reviews.text: Second kids Timex I have purchased. I think she got the first one too wet and it died in less than a year. I like that the bands can be replaced but limited options for that. Cute, affordable and easy to read for a child practicing time telling skills. Battery easy to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a child
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my niece and her daughter. Love that it has flashcards and the little clock so they can practice learning to tell time with on an analog watch.
customer_reviews.author: Donna A. Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch with terrible band
customer_reviews.text: The watch is a typically reliable Timex analog timepiece. The floral design is fairly appealing. I would have given that combination four stars if it weren't for the deficiencies with the band. First, the closing mechanism is the kind you find on some sports caps which require two hands for adjustments. This band requires that you take off the watch to change the size which is a hassle for anyone especially for children. That's bad enough but what makes it worse is that the closing mechanism is poorly made so it often doesn't lock properly. I would have returned this watch but didn't because my 8 year old lost it on the playground after taking it off for adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: band not as avertised
customer_reviews.text: band was supposed to be stretch band, but it had a primitive, almost a buckle, with tag ends sticking out ... not suitable for a gift ... returned
customer_reviews.author: Ken H

customer_reviews.title: it is easy to adjust and i love the elastic nature of ...
customer_reviews.text: As lovely as this wristwatch is, i give it a 4 star because the numbering and the lettering is almost illegible. Its so tiny and hard to see. But overall the wristwatch was made well, it is easy to adjust and i love the elastic nature of the material which makes it easy to wear and take off. My daughter loved it and the packaging was nice.
customer_reviews.author: Dupsy

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly big hit with the girls
customer_reviews.text: I'm the father of a 2 year old and got this for Christmas for her. It looked cool in that it teaches you to tell time, but as for design I'm pretty clueless. I would not have actually chosen this as a design, but my wife, my mother, and most importantly my daughter LOVED it, she wouldn't stop wearing it and playing with it. The wrist band is really well designed, it stretches and adjusts making it easy for her to slide it on/off, a crucial element (also it's inexpensive so should she slide it off at the movies it's not the end of the world). Dads: feel free to fire away at this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jason T

customer_reviews.title: Watch is junk
customer_reviews.text: I have this for Christmas so unfortunately by time I realized that the battery it came with wasn’t just dead but the watch itself was a dud I couldn’t return it. Great idea but the watch is junk...
customer_reviews.author: Nutmeeg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my daughter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a birthday present for my 11-year old daughter. She loves it and has been wearing it constantly. The band is a little smaller than I expected, but it fits her well and seems to be very comfortable. The push-button lighted dial face is a nice feature. It seems to be well-made, and so far is keeping perfect time. It wasn't clear to me from the product description, but there is a butterfly on the face that floats around clockwise and serves as the second hand - very cute, my daughter loves it, but if you need a more precise second hand, this is not the watch for you.
customer_reviews.author: C. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: She loves it and so do I
customer_reviews.text: Super cute, but kind of small for my 9 yr old's wrist. Also, there's no 45 marking on the watch face, but two 15's, which was confusing to her and me when I told her to be in at 5:15 for dinner. Other than that, it has made the days of yelling from my porch few and far between!
customer_reviews.author: Me!

customer_reviews.title: the watch tells time however, the "teaching" value of ...
customer_reviews.text: the watch tells time however, the "teaching" value of it is degraded significantly because the numbers are incredibly small and VERY hard to read. My 5 year old was really excited to get it and wear it but she couldn't read the numbers (because of how small they are rather than her inability to recognize time), so now the watch sits in a drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good kid's watch
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old daughter loves it, especially the indiglo. It is comfortable for her and everything is as advertised. My only complaint is the adjustment on the strap is a bit 'slippery' and when she puts it on it will slip to a slightly larger adjustment from time to time. My son has a similar band on his camo timex and it doesn't have this issue. Once the band gets a little wear to it like his, it won't be so slick and things will work out ok. Beyond that, it's a durable kid's watch. Better than anything else I've seen in stores that cost more. (I've tried them and they invariably break rather quickly)
customer_reviews.author: sojrner

customer_reviews.title: Band Is Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This watch works for everything that I purchased it for. However, it does not stay tight on my daughter’s wrist. Every time I tighten it, it completely loosens itself again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: She loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 7yo shopped around & asked to get this w her leftover Christmas money. Great for kids w skin sensitivity. She's been wearing it daily, without any issues & is happy w her purchase.
customer_reviews.author: christen bryant

customer_reviews.title: Cute, bright and cheerful kids watch
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this watch for my 2 year old daughter when she became obsessed with my watch, and trying to remove it from me! She loves this one, cute, bright and colourful, with the comfy elastic strap. The backlit watch face is a brilliant idea, of course the youngsters love anything that lights up, and its a pleasant luminous green that makes it easy to see in the dark. I've knocked one star off only because the strap adjustment is a bit fiddly. The child, like mine, will most likely need an adult to do it for them.
customer_reviews.author: Melodramie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Watch for a little girl learning to tell time
customer_reviews.text: I got this watch for a very sweet little girl that is in second grade her grandfather is trying to teach her to tell time with out a digital watch and I thought this would be perfect to help her out. She did not know she was getting it. When she got it she was so excited she loves the watch dearly . I recommend this to any one wanting to teach a child how to tell time with a real clock instead of a distal number.
customer_reviews.author: wisedavidsgirl121484

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality and Value for kid's learning time!
customer_reviews.text: Best watch I have found! I am giving this to my 6 yo for christmas. It was the only watch that was water resistant, has labeled hour and second hands, color highlighted half hour marks, easy to read second marks and flexible comfortable straps. The watch even comes with a lifetime warranty for defectiveness and loss. I couldn't ask for a better deal! All under $20, what a great learning to tell time device! She has been begging for a watch and I know we will get good use out of this watch and that it will truly last! Thank you Timex for creating a watch considering the adverse situations it may endure with our little ones!
customer_reviews.author: Kashmir

customer_reviews.title: Great teaching tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my granddaughter so she would learn to tell time on a real clock. It worked great she started telling time the same day
customer_reviews.author: mrcemc

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: Watch is good but is made to only work with a unique style of strap you wont find anywhere. Included strap gets dirty fast.
customer_reviews.author: EwoK

customer_reviews.title: Easy first watch! Great for a 3 year old.
customer_reviews.text: The kid loves it. She can put it on herself and it's water resistant! There's a small butterfly for the seconds hand on ours. Update: she's now taken several baths and plenty of water play with this on and it hasn't fogged up or quit working yet.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This watch is so cute. My daughter loves it and it fits well. I love the stretch wrist band.
customer_reviews.author: Jeje

product_meta.title: Timex Girls Time Machines Analog Elastic Fabric Strap Watch
product_meta.description:
Get along swimmingly in this adorable Timex; watch! Resin case. Elastic strap with sea-life pattern. Round face. Three-hand analog display with quartz movement. Dial features pink and blue-tone hands and hour markers, minute track, and Timex detailing. Water resistant. Display case included. Imported. Measurements: Case Height: 28 mm Case Width: 28 mm Case Depth: 9 mm;5 in Band Circumference/Length: 9 in Weight: 0.6 oz




PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :Yes
 * Product Dimensions :3.65 x 2.25 x 2.6 inches; 0.48 Ounces
 * Item model number :T89022
 * Department :Girls
 * Batteries :1 Lithium Metal batteries required. (included)
 * Date First Available :May 2, 2004
 * Manufacturer :Timex
 * ASIN :B0000TIKK8

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #5,977 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry (See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry)  *  #1 inGirls' Wrist Watches 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.3 out of 5 stars2,743 ratings Get along swimmingly in this adorable Timex; watch! Resin case. Elastic strap with sea-life pattern. Round face. Three-hand analog display with quartz movement. Dial features pink and blue-tone hands and hour markers, minute track, and Timex detailing. Water resistant. Display case included. Imported. Measurements: Case Height: 28 mm Case Width: 28 mm Case Depth: 9 mm;5 in Band Circumference/Length: 9 in Weight: 0.6 oz
feature_bullets: White easy-to-read dial with minutes marked for Learning
Rotating flower graphic as second hand
Water resistant to 30m (100ft): in general, withstands splashes or brief immersion in water, but not suitable for swimming or bathing
